rev.comment: Cosbycoin is likely just a "joke", updating article to reflect that
rev.diff:
Line 183: Line 183:
* July 26, 2011, Bitomat re-opened after being unavailable for 5 days with the message that they had lost all funds on site after rebooting their Amazon EC2 instance.<ref>[http://www.launch.is/blog/bitomat-loses-data-and-mybitcoin-shuts-down-new-bitcoin-cris.html Bitomat loses data]</ref><ref>https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Bitomat Bitcoin wiki - Bitomat]</ref>
* July 26, 2011, Bitomat re-opened after being unavailable for 5 days with the message that they had lost all funds on site after rebooting their Amazon EC2 instance.<ref>[http://www.launch.is/blog/bitomat-loses-data-and-mybitcoin-shuts-down-new-bitcoin-cris.html Bitomat loses data]</ref><ref>https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/Bitomat Bitcoin wiki - Bitomat]</ref>
* August 5, 2011, MyBitcoin issued a statement that they had been compromised and lost 49% of their user's funds.<ref>[https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/MyBitcoin Bitcoin wiki - MyBitcoin]</ref>
* August 5, 2011, MyBitcoin issued a statement that they had been compromised and lost 49% of their user's funds.<ref>[https://en.bitcoin.it/wiki/MyBitcoin Bitcoin wiki - MyBitcoin]</ref>
â
* September 9, 2011, people from [[Something Awful]]'s forum hacked into the Bitcointalk forums, stole the password hash, and injected code to alter the site into a Cosbycoin (successor [[cryptocurrency]]) forum complete with gags.<ref>http://www.scmagazine.com.au/News/271688,bitcoin-forum-hacked-by-donor.aspx</ref><ref>http://cryptome.org/0005/bitcoin-hashleak.htm</ref><ref>http://buttcoin.org/bitcointalk-forums-hacked-bill-cosby-pimping-new-cosbycoins%E2%84%A2-to-all-the-members-breaking This one constantly updates with links to new news articles</ref><ref>http://alphavilleherald.com/2011/09/cosbycoin-forum-hack-pops-bitcoin-forum-bubble.html</ref><ref>http://bitcoinnews.net/2011/09/10/bitcointalk-forums-hacked-bill-cosby-pimping-new-cosbycoins%e2%84%a2-to-all-the-members/</ref><ref>http://www.meneame.net/story/bitcointalk-foro-official-unofficial-bitcoin-hackeado-eng</ref>
+
* September 9, 2011, people from [[Something Awful]]'s forum hacked into the Bitcointalk forums, stole the password hash, and injected code to alter the site with Cosbycoin gags.<ref>http://www.scmagazine.com.au/News/271688,bitcoin-forum-hacked-by-donor.aspx</ref><ref>http://cryptome.org/0005/bitcoin-hashleak.htm</ref><ref>http://buttcoin.org/bitcointalk-forums-hacked-bill-cosby-pimping-new-cosbycoins%E2%84%A2-to-all-the-members-breaking This one constantly updates with links to new news articles</ref><ref>http://alphavilleherald.com/2011/09/cosbycoin-forum-hack-pops-bitcoin-forum-bubble.html</ref><ref>http://bitcoinnews.net/2011/09/10/bitcointalk-forums-hacked-bill-cosby-pimping-new-cosbycoins%e2%84%a2-to-all-the-members/</ref><ref>http://www.meneame.net/story/bitcointalk-foro-official-unofficial-bitcoin-hackeado-eng</ref>
<ref>http://fancyshowtech.tv/2011/09/episode-7-cosbycoins-bitcoin-review/</ref><ref>http://siliconangle.com/blog/2011/09/12/forum-user-passwords-possibly-stolen-in-bitcointalk-org-bill-cosby-hack/</ref>
